thread.title: Chevron Phillips Chemical Announces that Maricela Caballero will Succeed Greg Wagner as Vice President of Human Resources

author: cnbc.com
title: Chevron Phillips Chemical Announces that Maricela Caballero will Succeed Greg Wagner as Vice President of Human Resources
text:
THE WOODLANDS, Texas--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Chevron Phillips Chemical Company LLC (Chevron Phillips Chemical) announced today that Greg Wagner, vice president of Human Resources, will retire from the company after 35 years of distinguished service with Chevron Phillips Chemical and Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX). The company also announced that Maricela Caballero will replace Mr. Wagner effective May 16, 2018.
“Over the last six years, Greg has significantly advanced CPChem’s efforts to attract, retain and develop top talent in our industry, and his contributions will have a lasting impact on our organization. We wish Greg and his family all the best for a happy and healthy retirement,” said Mark Lashier, president and CEO, Chevron Phillips Chemical.
Caballero, previously general manager, Human Resources Strategic Business Partnerships and Talent Management Execution, has 30 years of service with Chevron Phillips Chemical and Chevron Corporation. Since the inception of Chevron Phillips Chemical in 2000, she has steadily progressed through the Human Resources organization in various roles of increasing responsibility at multiple company facilities.
“Maricela is a proven leader who brings a wealth of institutional knowledge to her new role,” said Lashier. “I am pleased that she will be joining our leadership team and know that she will continue to work to ensure we have the right people with the right skills ready to shape our future growth.”
About Chevron Phillips Chemical Company LLC
Chevron Phillips Chemical Company LLC is one of the world’s top producers of olefins and polyolefins and a leading supplier of aromatics, alpha olefins, styrenics, specialty chemicals, plastic piping and polymer resins. With approximately 5,000 employees, the LLC and its affiliates own $16.5 billion in assets, including 33 manufacturing and research facilities in seven countries. Chevron Phillips Chemical Company LLC is equally owned by Chevron U.S.A. Inc., an indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Chevron Corporation, and by wholly-owned subsidiaries of Phillips 66, and is headquartered in The Woodlands, Texas.
